Title: Manufacturing Software Engineer
Full Job Description:
As a Manufacturing Software Engineer, you will be responsible for gathering and analyzing requirements, developing, testing, maintaining and debugging digital solutions. Your role will involve the digitalization of manufacturing operations, developing and supporting shopfloor applications, automating data collection and retrieval workflows, creating and implementing complex data transformation, analytics and machine learning algorithms in manufacturing and supply chain processes.
Responsibilities
Lead and collaborate with management, business teams, IT and other software engineers to create digital solutions to enhance productivity and enable data-driven decision-making across organizations.
Understand the needs of the manufacturing & supply chain operations and translate them into technical requirements.
Develop and implement software and analytics applications, ensuring seamless data and workflows integration to support business needs and priorities.
Design and execute test plans to ensure new software meets specifications, functionalities and performance requirements.
Integrate, consolidate and cleanse data, developing algorithms to transform it into usable and actionable information, structured for analytical and workflow applications.
Maintain and provide support to existing applications, ensuring minimal downtime and disruptions.
Ensure compliance with data governance and security policies.
Study and evaluate technology designs to identify opportunities for optimizing data and solution architecture, enhancing application performance.
Stay updated on industry trends and technological advancements, leveraging appropriate technologies and best practice to improve solution delivery.
Requirements:
Bachelor’s Degree in Software Engineering, Computer Science or equivalent, with minimum 5 years of relevant industrial working experience.
Experience in full stack software development, software development lifecycle, modern data stack and data integration.
Demonstrate track records in development and deployment of data pipeline and business intelligence solutions in various supply chain and manufacturing use cases.
Good programming knowledge (SQL, Python, Java, C#, VB, .NET etc.) and understanding in ETL tools and REST APIs.
Experience with relational and non-relational databases such as MSSQL, MongoDB, PostgreSQL etc.
Experience with big data, data warehouse and data lake technologies such as AWS S3, Redshift etc. will be an added advantage.
Hands-on experience in BI platforms (Qliksense, Power BI etc.) and artificial intelligence/machine learning will be added advantage.
Possess strong analytical, critical thinking and leadership skills, with excellent collaboration, stakeholder management, oral and written communication skills.
Meticulous in execution, reporting and defect analysis.
Self-starter and proven track record of results in implementing complex projects and demonstrated levels of creativity towards achieving goals.
Ability to learn new skills and technologies quickly, being aware of current issues affecting industry and its technologies. Comfortable switching between technologies.
Able to work effectively in a team environment and individually.

Title: Software Developer - Digital Manufacturing
Full Job Description:
Company Description
Bosch in Malaysia is a part of the Bosch Group, a leading global supplier of technology and services. The Bosch Group’s strategic objective is to deliver innovations for a connected life. Bosch improves quality of life worldwide with products and services that are innovative and spark enthusiasm. In short, Bosch creates technology that is “Invented for life”. Bosch has been present in Malaysia since 1923, represented by Robert Bosch Sdn Bhd. In Malaysia, Bosch is active in four business sectors: Mobility Solutions, Industrial Technology, Consumer Goods, and Energy and Building Technology.
The company has three manufacturing sites and research and development offices in Penang, producing automotive electronics, power tools and steering systems, and now a fourth plant with a final testing centre for sensors and semiconductors.
PgP5 Plant is Bosch Group’s newest expansion in Malaysia a semiconductor test site in Batu Kawan Penang. The construction has begun in May 2021 and first series of production commenced in 2023. With the long-term forecasts for growth of semiconductor component quantities, coupled with the front-end production in Bosch’s Dresden facility in Germany, capacity expansion is required for the back-end production, which is the final testing phase of semiconductors and sensors. PgP5 will primarily focus on the final testing of components manufactured at Bosch Automotive Electronics’ fab in Dresden, Germany. The plant will also house R&D and training facilities.
Job Description
As a Software Developer in the Digital Manufacturing department, you will develop and deliver, together with an internationally distributed team, software applications and solutions within the Mobility Electronics (ME) sector. Become part of our team and contribute to the future of ME!
In your role you will:
Develop software for various plants, an enabler for innovation in the semiconductor industry. We work on techniques which increase the quality of fabrication
Design, develop, test, document, deploy and maintain efficient, reusable, and reliable software while ensuring performance and quality standards
Analyze, debug and solve defects of existing functionalities
Participate actively in code reviews
Work in an agile environment within internationally distributed teams
Guide and mentor less experienced team members as well as contribute to technical on-boarding of new joiners
Qualifications
Minimum 3 years of experience in a related field
Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Information Technology or equivalent
Technical background within the semiconductor business
Excellent programming skills in a high-level language (Java, C++, C#, Go, Python)
Strong understanding of microservice architecture principles, including API design best practices (e.g., RESTful APIs, gRPC)
Strong experience with SQL and relational databases, particularly Oracle DB. Familiarity with NoSQL databases (e.g., MongoDB, Cassandra)
DevOps Skills: Experience with infrastructure automation, system configuration management (e.g., Jenkins), and container orchestration (e.g., Docker ecosystem, Kubernetes)
Software Configuration Management, Build systems, and version control (e.g., Git, Subversion, Maven, Sonatype Nexus, SonarQube)
Experience with specific testing frameworks (e.g., JUnit, Mockito, Selenium)
Experience with project management tools and processes (e.g., Confluence, Jira)
Strong interest in modern technologies, agile mindset and ability to work under pressure
Good communication skills (Verbal and Written) especially in meetings and reviews with all levels and departments
Able to work in an intercultural team
Reliability and flexibility to work in a pioneer team
Structured and independent way of working, analytical skills
Willingness to take over responsibility
Fluent in English (written and spoken), German skills are a plus
Additional Information
Benefits
Benefits: Company Insurances, Transport Allowance, Flexi Work hours, Car Loan Subsidy, Meal Subsidy, EPF, etc.
Leave Entitlement e.g. Annual Leave, Medical Leave, etc.

Title: Senior AI Transformation Analyst (Hyrbid working)
Full Job Description:
Company Description
About SEEK
At SEEK, we serve a noble purpose: to help people live more productive and fulfilling working lives and to help organisations succeed.
By joining us, you’ll be part of a multinational technology business that is far-reaching with a start-up working culture that focuses on a set of collaborative values and appreciates dynamic cultures. SEEK is a place where potential meets possibility – it’s where your career aspiration and our purpose can make great things happen.
Why join us?
We’re looking for people who thrive in dynamic teams, appreciate progressive industries, and enjoy tackling regular new challenges in a large-scale, modern, and agile environment. As one of Asia Pacific’s largest tech companies, you’ll contribute to multilingual systems, solving high-impact problems to the benefit of millions of people within the region. Expect a great investment in your career development with access to workshops, conferences & courses while you work alongside seasoned experts. Be part of a fast-growing company with a strong culture and clear purpose, innovation and strong investment in responsible AI. SEEK offers you the opportunity to be involved in impactful work and be part of a great team.
Job Description
The Team
AI for SEEK team is part of the broader SEEK AI Group which includes over 200 AI professionals delivering AI services for our core products under the Group Executive, AI. The AI for SEEK team is responsible for driving operational excellence and continuous improvement within SEEK by identifying, testing, developing / adopting innovative AI solutions that improve productivity and operational efficiency.
This role reports to the Head of AI Transformation.
About the role
As the Senior AI Transformation Analyst, you will play a key role in SEEK's strategic AI adoption journey, driving enterprise-wide transformation that enhances operational excellence and market competitiveness.. You will work closely with teams and leaders across SEEK to educate the business on AI capabilities and risks, identify and prioritise opportunities, run experiments, procure and implement AI tools, and track and report on benefits.
This dynamic and ambiguous space demands critical thinking and a flexible mindset, combining knowledge of AI capabilities with SEEK’s operational and marketplace goals and strong commercial and problem solving skills.
Responsibilities
Strategic AI Transformation: Strategic AI Transformation:
Lead development of long-term AI strategies aligned with SEEK's business objectives. Independently manage complex, high-value transformation projects from conception through implementation, including budget oversight and investment planning.
Business Process Optimisation:
Analyze workflows to identify AI enhancement opportunities and handle ambiguous, enterprise-wide challenges requiring cross-functional collaboration. Partner with senior stakeholders to optimize processes and translate business needs into technical requirements.
Project & Change Management:
Oversee project deliverables while building stakeholder relationships to secure adoption buy-in. Conduct impact assessments and develop implementation plans that address potential challenges and ensure projects meet timelines and objectives.
User Education:
Collaborate with L&D, RAI, workplace experience and functional teams to design and deliver training programs to educate users on new processes, AI tools and technologies. Provide ongoing support and resources to ensure successful adoption.
Performance Monitoring and Optimization:
Monitor the performance of AI solutions, capture feedback and identify opportunities for optimization. Collect and analyze data to measure the qualitative and quantitative benefits of AI initiatives, and make data-driven recommendations for improvements.
Innovation and Continuous Improvement:
Stay up-to-date with the latest trends and advancements in AI and digital transformation. Propose innovative solutions and continuous improvement initiatives to enhance business processes and drive commercial growth.
AI Community Development:
Establish a community of practice to drive better AI adoption across SEEK including building a library of prompts and chatbots, identification of opportunities and building a core team of AI expertise to drive everyday innovation on the ground.
Qualifications
Skills and experience
Demonstrated expertise in business process analysis, project coordination, and change management.
Strong commercial acumen with a solid understanding of AI concepts, capable of translating qualitative and quantitative metrics into business benefits/ROI.
Strong aptitude for learning and a keen interest in emerging AI concepts and current industry trends.
Excellent critical thinking, problem-solving, research, and analytics skills.
Experience with Salesforce, Workday, marketing automation, and conversational AI technologies is highly preferred.
Other Qualifications, Skills and Experience
The following experience is preferred, but not essential:
5+ years of experience in AI transformation, business analysis, or related fields
Demonstrated success in delivering multiple complex initiatives with measurable business impact
Proven ability to independently manage high-value transformation projects from ideation through execution
Additional Information
Perks and benefits
At SEEK we offer:
Support of flexible working, including a mix of office and work from home days depending on your role.
The opportunity to work from anywhere for up to 4 weeks per financial year
Casual dress – every day
At SEEK, we are passionate about fostering a culture of inclusion and wellbeing that embraces and values the diversity of our people. We are a purpose driven business that works with heart.
We know teams with diverse ideas, experiences and perspectives are more creative and are critical to ensuring effective delivery and innovating to enable our future success. As such, we welcome applications from people with diverse backgrounds and life experiences, especially as they relate to gender, sexual identity, culture, faith, disability and life stages. If you have the skills, curiosity and an adaptable mindset but don't meet every responsibility or qualification listed in this advertisement, please still get in touch with us.
Should you require any specific support or adjustments throughout the recruitment process and beyond, please advise us and we will be happy to assist.
For this role, only those with eligible right to work will be considered.
SEEK kindly requests no unsolicited resumes or approaches from recruitment agencies and will not be responsible for any associated fees.

4. 精通Java/Scala编程及常用设计模式，熟悉Spark、Flink等大数据编程技术与原理；

Title: Data Analyst
Full Job Description:
职位描述：​
熟悉数据定义及其特征，从各种数据库中执行ETL。这包括执行数据转换、清理、可视化和挖掘，以获得业务洞察力。然后将洞察力传达给利益相关者，这些洞察力可以是仪表板和具有影响力的可视化报告的形式。​
积极分析数据，以问题解决者的心态回答利益相关者的关键问题。调查推动业务绩效的因素，并与利益相关者沟通需要在优化效率和生产力方面改进的领域。​
设计数据驱动的A/B测试，对用户行为、转化优化和网页设计原则有很好的理解。​
协助简化和自动化向各部门提交的分析报告​
协助组织信息并支持构建知识管理和共享信息架构的倡议
职位需求：
本科及以上学历，理工类专业（数学、统计学、计算机科学、软件工程等相关专业）优先
有使用数据分析/商业智能工具的经验，如
Python
、SQL、Tableau、PowerBI、Microsoft Excel和/或其他工具。具有ETL和数据库的实践经验将是有利的。​
具备强大的统计分析技能，具有处理多个指标/关键指标的经验，为技术和非技术利益相关者提供分析建议和业务见解。这包括挖掘、评估和可视化。​
强大的中英文口头、书面和演示沟通能力​
有产品管理经验，熟悉SaaS产品者优先。​
3年以上工作经验
Job description:
Perform ETL from various databases with familiarity in understanding the data definitions and its characteristics. This includes performing data transformation, cleaning, visualization and mining to obtain business insights. The insights are then communicated to stakeholders, which can be in the form of dashboards and reports with impactful visualization.
Proactively analyses data to answer key questions for stakeholders, with a problem solver mindset. Investigates what drives business performance and communicate to stakeholders on areas that need to be improved in optimizing efficiency and productivity.
Design data-driven A/B testing, with the good understanding of user behaviour, conversion optimization and web design principles.
Assist with the effort to streamline and automate analytical reports to various departments.
Assist to organize information and support the initiative to build information architecture for knowledge management and sharing
Job requirements:
Bachelor's degree or above, science and engineering majors (mathematics, statistics, computer science, software engineering and other related majors) are preferred.
Experience working with data analytic/business intelligence tools such as
Python
, SQL, Tableau, Power BI, Microsoft Excel and/or other tools. Hands-on experience with ETL and databases will be advantageous.
Possesses strong statistical analytical skills with experience working with multiple metrics/key indicators, providing analytical recommendations and business insights to technical and non-technical stakeholders. This includes mining, evaluation and visualization.
Strong verbal, written and presentation communications skills in Mandarin and English. We are seeking candidates proficient in Mandarin to effectively communicate with Mandarin-speaking clients.
Experience in product management and familiarity with SaaS product preferred.

Title: Senior Data Engineer
Full Job Description:
Overview of Responsibilities:
The Senior Data Engineer will oversee the company’s data ingestion / integration work, including
developing a data model, maintaining a data warehouse and analytics environment, and writing scripts
for data ingestion / integration and analysis. This role will work closely and collaboratively with
members of the Data & Analytics and Development teams to define requirements, mine and analyze
data, integrate data from a variety of sources, and deploy high quality data pipelines in support of the
analytics needs. He will also be responsible for creating automated reporting / data visualization system
based on the request of internal stakeholders.
Description of Duties:
• Maintain and build on our data warehouse and analytics environment, the home for various
source data generated in the company.
• Design, implement, test, deploy, and maintain stable, secure, and scalable data engineering
solutions and pipelines in support of data and analytics projects, including integrating new
sources of data into our central data warehouse, and moving data out to applications.
• Build reports and data visualizations, using data from the data warehouse and other sources.
• Produce scalable, replicable code and engineering solutions that help automate repetitive data
management tasks.
• Perform one-off data manipulation and analysis on a wide variety of source data.
• Implement and monitor best in class security measures in our data warehouse and analytics
environment.
• Help other data team staff troubleshoot their SQL, Python, or R code.
• Train other data team staff on these skills.
• Other duties as assigned.
Qualifications:
• Strong command of relational databases and SQL. Extract, Transform, and Load (ETL) data into a
relational database.
• Proficiency with Python or R, especially for data manipulation and analysis, and ability to build,
maintain and deploy sequences of automated processes with these tools.
• BA or BS in related field or equivalent work experience.
• General data manipulation skills: read in data, process and clean it, transform and recode it,
merge different data sets together, reformat data between wide and long, etc.
• Demonstrated ability to learn new techniques and troubleshoot code without support, ex. find
answers to common programming challenges on Google. In other words, be able to learn on the
job.

Title: Data Research & Specialist (VDS)
Full Job Description:
Job Defination
The VDS Data Specialist role offers a unique opportunity to explore and analyze the automotive aftermarket in the Southeast Asia (SEA) region. If you are detail-oriented and passionate about data accuracy, this role is an excellent fit. You will play a key part in supporting our mission to maintain high-quality, reliable automotive data across multiple markets.
Fresh graduates from the automotive field are most welcome to apply. If you are passionate about data-related work and eager to grow in a technical and fast-paced environment, we encourage you to join us.
Job Responsibilities
Able to follow the designated workflow designed by the company such as a Standard Operating Procedure.
Perform PESTLE analysis on each respective countries’ automotive market in SEA region.
Research and collect domestic / foreign automotive data and parts information from reliable sources in SEA region according to company’s requirement.
Investigate the collected information to ensure that the information is complete and correct, and the input it into the system.
Identify errors in the data and correct it according to existing workflow.
Generate reports by analyzing the collected or given information.
Cooperate with the leader and departments in daily operations as well as provide technical support internally to ensure the projects are delivered on time.
Job Skills & Qualifications
Diploma or degree in Data Management, Vehicle Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or related fields.
1–2 years of experience working with large data sets, preferably within the automotive industry or related fields.
Strong understanding of the automotive industry; experience in the automotive aftermarket is highly valued.
Proficient in MS Office, with advanced Excel skills.
Familiarity with Access and SQL is an added advantage.
Excellent communication and written English skills.
Personal Traits:
Proactive, hardworking, and detail-oriented.
Self-disciplined, self-motivated, and trustworthy.
Logical thinker capable of handling tasks under pressure.
A good team player with excellent coordination and learning abilities.
Interest or passion for the automotive field is an advantage.

Title: Data Engineer
Full Job Description:
Key Responsibilities
1.Design, develop, and maintain robust ETL pipelines to process and transform data from various sources into structured formats.
2.Collaborate with stakeholders to understand data requirements and implement solutions that meet business needs.
3.Ensure data integrity, security, and availability across all stages of the data lifecycle.
4.Optimize data storage and retrieval processes for performance and scalability.
5.Develop and maintain data models, schemas, and metadata documentation.
6.Monitor and troubleshoot data systems to ensure smooth operation and timely resolution of issues.
7.Implement best practices for data governance, including compliance with privacy and regulatory standards.
8.Stay updated on emerging data technologies and trends to recommend innovative solutions.
Qualifications
Required Skills and Experience
1.Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Information Technology, or a related field.
2.3+ years of experience in data engineering, with expertise in building and managing ETL workflows.
3.Proficiency with ETL tools commonly used in data engineering (e.g., SSIS).
4.3+ years of experience of programming languages such as Python.
5.3+ years of experience in SQL and database management systems (e.g., MySQL, SQL Server).
6.Understanding of data warehousing concepts.
7.Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to work collaboratively within a team.
Preferred Skills
1.Familiar with cloud platforms like AWS and Azure.
2.Hands-on experience with ETL environments using Azure Data Factory, Azure Data Lake, Databricks, Synapse.
3.Experience with big data technologies such as Hadoop, Spark.
4.Experience with data visualization tools and techniques.

Title: Software Engineer
Full Job Description:
Company Description
About SEEK
SEEK operates market-leading online employment marketplaces, including Jobstreet and Jobsdb in Asia. SEEK has been helping people live more fulfilling and productive working lives and helping organisations succeed for over 25 years.
Founded and headquartered in Melbourne, Australia, SEEK has grown into a multinational technology company with over 3,300 employees and is listed on the Australian Securities Exchange.
SEEK’s presence spans Australia, New Zealand, Hong Kong, Indonesia, Malaysia, the Philippines, Singapore and Thailand. Additionally, SEEK has minority investments in employment marketplaces in China, South Korea and Bangladesh.
SEEK develops and applies innovative data and technology tools to facilitate high-quality matching and improve reliability of marketplace information.
In 2021, 2022, 2023 and 2024, SEEK was recognised as one of Australia’s Top Ten Places to Work in Technology in the AFR BOSS Best Places to Work awards. SEEK was also named a 5-Star Employer of Choice by HRD Asia in 2024 and won four accolades at TalentCorp’s Life at Work Awards 2023 in Malaysia.
Job Description
The Role
This role is within the Personalisation squad in AIPS, working on complex engineering solutions that power job personalisation contents for many millions of job seekers in Australia and Asia every day
Work in a passionate, dynamic, growing environment with the ability to learn and adapt quickly to new methodologies and technologies
Actively participate and contribute in communities of practice at SEEK and beyond; pursue mastery of software delivery and inspire such pursuit in others
Participate in the design, definition and development of software components and data systems, including prioritisation and planning, to meet your team goals
Assist in being responsible for your Squad’s services in production, its consistent uptime, troubleshooting, data governance and agreed SLAs
Ensure that systems are adequately developed, tested, and are fit for purpose
Collaborate with Data Scientists, Optimization Analysts, Data Engineers and Strategy Managers to deliver excellent software for our partners in an agile environment
Key Responsibilities
Turn sophisticated requirements into practical solutions
Design and implement robust, scalable components with a focus on performance
Own system components, including implementation and managing technical debt
Ensure high service availability and meet SLAs
Collaborate with data scientists, ontologists, and engineering managers in an agile environment
Contribute to system roadmaps and capacity planning
Develop comprehensive testing strategies
Drive continuous delivery practices and improve team efficiency
Support and mentor team members, removing obstacles
Balance immediate delivery needs with long-term sustainability
Design and conduct experiments to evaluate algorithms
Participate in on-call rotation for critical services
Align technical solutions with AIPS strategy and objectives
Qualifications
Required Qualifications :
Knows well at least one of the following languages and happy to learn the others:
Java
Rust
Python
Go
Typescript
Experience with AWS cloud platform
Overall understanding of machine learning, deep learning, and LLMs
Experience with functional programming is a plus
Proven track record to build and maintain scalable, resilient systems
Skilled in crafting robust software architecture
Experience with CI/CD pipelines and modern DevOps practices
Professional Skills:
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills
Strong collaborator management and requirements gathering
Clear and effective communication
Success in cross-functional teamwork
Dedication to continuous learning and staying updated with industry trends
Additional Information
The Team
The AI & Platform Services (AIPS) team exists within the Seek Group and provides AI-centric core services that scale globally including search, behavioural tracking, recommendations, candidate matching, ontological services and personalisation. AIPS works primarily with internal partners, providing services to these partners, who in turn deliver products to customers (candidates, hirers). Members of the AIPS team fall into one of three primary roles
AI (artificial intelligence and machine learning)
Strategy (business, product, go to market)
Engineering (development, DevOps, responsible for production systems)
People representing each of these roles are combined into squads which are in turn responsible for related sets of business services.
Why SEEK!
Mature and collaborative working culture
Hybrid working mode
Extensive employee benefits
Ample of career growth opportunities
At SEEK, we are passionate about fostering a culture of inclusion and wellbeing that embraces and values the diversity of our people. We are a purpose driven business that works with heart.
We know teams with diverse ideas, experiences and perspectives are more creative and are critical to ensuring effective delivery and innovating to enable our future success. As such, we welcome applications from people with diverse backgrounds and life experiences, especially as they relate to gender, sexual identity, culture, faith, disability and life stages. If you have the skills, curiosity and an adaptable mindset but don't meet every responsibility or qualification listed in this advertisement, please still get in touch with us.
Should you require any specific support or adjustments throughout the recruitment process and beyond, please advise us and we will be happy to assist.
SEEK kindly requests no unsolicited resumes or approaches from recruitment agencies and will not be responsible for any associated fees.

Title: Technical Support Engineer (Data and AI Intelligent Platform)
Full Job Description:

With over 17,000 employees worldwide, the mission of the Customer Experience & Success (CE&S) organization is to empower customers to accelerate business value through differentiated customer experiences that leverage Microsoft’s products and services, ignited by our people and culture. Come join CE&S and help us build a future where customers achieve their business outcomes faster with technology that does more.
Join Microsoft Azure AI support team and unlock your potential in the AI world!

You will also collaborate with others to engage subject matter experts, Engineering (Product Groups) or Management.

As employees we come together with a growth mindset, innovate to empower others and collaborate to realize our shared goals. areas

, and

These requirements include, but are not limited to the following specialized security screenings: Microsoft Cloud Background Check: This position will be required to pass the Microsoft Cloud Background Check upon hire / transfer and every two years thereafter.

Title: ETL Data Engineer
Full Job Description:
Experience Level & Education
• Minimum 5 years of IT working experience, specifically in Data Engineering and ETL-related work.
• Undergraduate or master’s degree in computer science, Information Technology, Engineering, or a related field.
Only open to Malaysian citizen.
Main Purpose & Job Scope
• Support Assy & Test manufacturing data analytics operations and projects.

Required Qualifications
• Strong experience in Business Intelligence or Data Analytics projects.

• Background in quantitative analysis statistics, math, and data modeling is a plus.
• Prior experience in a manufacturing domain is advantageous.
• Familiarity with Agile methodologies and project management practices is beneficial.
• Should be comfortable working in cross-functional virtual teams.

Data pipeline construction:

Title: Data Engineer / Data Systems Specialist
Full Job Description:
The Data Systems Specialist role is part of the
Data and Analytics team
at Ambu Global Hub located in Penang. Our team is uniquely international, with members from around the world, and engages with business stakeholders globally. We are on a transformative journey, establishing a new foundation of processes, ownership, and technology, with a major focus on developing a cutting-edge Data Platform in the Microsoft Azure cloud.
Role Responsibilities:
As a Data Systems Specialist / Data Engineer, you’ll be responsible for:
1.    Data Warehousing:
Managing and maintaining the data warehouse to ensure data integrity and availability.
Implementing data warehousing concepts and architecture, such as Ralph Kimball methodologies.
Integrating data from various sources, ensuring seamless data flow and consistency across systems.
Developing and maintaining data integration processes to support business operations.
2.    ETL Development:
Building and maintaining dynamic and complex ETL processes.
Extracting, transforming, and loading data into the data warehouse.
3.    Data Modelling and Design:
Designing and creating data models that facilitate efficient querying and reporting.
Ensuring data accuracy and consistency.
4.    Performance Tuning and Optimization:
Ensuring data systems perform efficiently.
Monitoring query performance.
Fine-tuning data retrieval processes.
5.    Data Governance and Security:
Implementing data governance policies and ensuring data security.
Implementing access controls.
Managing data lineage and compliance.
6.    Report and Dashboard Development:
Ability to understand or create interactive dashboards, reports, and visualizations for business users.
Empowering business users with self-service reporting.
Qualifications:
Minimum of 3 years solid in Data Warehousing, Data Engineering, or Business Intelligence Development (Must).
At least 3 year(s) of experience with SQL, Data Integration, Implementing Data Quality Checks and Data Modelling (Must).
Proficiency in MS SSIS, Azure Data Factory, SQL, MS SQL Database, Azure DevOps, and Data Integration Tools (Must).
Experience with Power BI, ServiceNow, Qlik, Tableau, C, C++, C#, Python, or R (Beneficial).
Solid understanding of Ralph Kimball methodologies (Must).
Experience with ETL development, Data Integration, and Data Warehousing (Must).
Ability to analyse complex, large data sets, data models, data mining, and segmentation techniques for a global organization (Must).
Fluent in English (Must).
Certificates from Microsoft in Azure Data Platform, Azure Data Factory, Power BI, Database, ETL Tools, and SQL Server/Cloud Services (Preferred).
Self-starter, principled, and driven to do the right thing for the organization (Preferred).
Bonus points for:
Experience working in an Agile/Scrum environment.
Knowledge of Medical industries or Medical Manufacturing business domains.
Why Join Ambu?
Innovation at the Core
: Ambu thrives on innovation. We encourage our teams to think beyond conventions, explore new possibilities, and create groundbreaking solutions that impact lives.
Quality First
: Our products are more than just devices; they’re lifelines. Quality is not just a checkbox; it’s embedded in our DNA. When you work at Ambu, you contribute to something greater—a legacy of excellence.
Core Values
:
Take Charge
: We empower our employees to take ownership, drive change, and lead with conviction.
Team Up
: Collaboration is key. We believe in the strength of diverse minds working together to achieve remarkable results.
Be True
: Authenticity matters. At Ambu, we value integrity, transparency, and ethical behavior.
Transformative Journey
: Ambu is on an exciting transformative journey. We’re building a new foundation—one that embraces modern processes, ownership, and cutting-edge technology. Our focus areas include:
Cloud Data Platform
: We’re establishing a robust Data Platform in the cloud using Microsoft Azure. As a BI Developer, you’ll play a pivotal role in shaping this platform and turning data into actionable insights.
Business Process Automation
: Our goal is to streamline business processes through digitalization. As part of our team, you’ll contribute to automating workflows, enhancing efficiency, and driving productivity.
Global Engagement
: Join an international team that collaborates with business stakeholders across the globe. Your work will have a direct impact on decision-making, strategy, and Ambu’s continued success.

Title: Senior Software Engineer (Java, Python & ML)
Full Job Description:
Company Description
About SEEK
SEEK operates market-leading online employment marketplaces, including Jobstreet and Jobsdb in Asia. SEEK has been helping people live more fulfilling and productive working lives and helping organisations succeed for over 25 years.
Founded and headquartered in Melbourne, Australia, SEEK has grown into a multinational technology company with over 3,300 employees and is listed on the Australian Securities Exchange.
SEEK’s presence spans Australia, New Zealand, Hong Kong, Indonesia, Malaysia, the Philippines, Singapore and Thailand. Additionally, SEEK has minority investments in employment marketplaces in China, South Korea and Bangladesh.
SEEK develops and applies innovative data and technology tools to facilitate high-quality matching and improve reliability of marketplace information.
In 2021, 2022, 2023 and 2024, SEEK was recognised as one of Australia’s Top Ten Places to Work in Technology in the AFR BOSS Best Places to Work awards. SEEK was also named a 5-Star Employer of Choice by HRD Asia in 2024 and won four accolades at TalentCorp’s Life at Work Awards 2023 in Malaysia.
Job Description
The Role
The successful candidate will be an experienced Senior Engineer with demonstrable experience in all stages of the development lifecycle.
Day to day tasks include:
Participating in the design and definition of software components to meet your Squads remit, considering robustness, fault tolerance, scalability and performance.
Being responsible for your service in production, its consistent uptime, troubleshooting, non-functional SLAs.
Ensuring that systems are adequately developed, tested, and are fit for purpose.
Collaborating closely with Data Scientists, Product Managers, and Analysts to deliver excellent software for our partners in an agile environment.
Working in a passionate, dynamic, growing environment with the ability to learn and adapt quickly to new methodologies and technologies.
Driving towards continuous delivery; Act as an enabler for your team members, removing obstacles from their paths and identifying potentials for delivery, business and process improvements.
Strive for technical excellence; Help communicate the healthy tension between the desire for immediate delivery and the long-term viability of the code base.
Support experiments to assess performance of various algorithms and use the results to iteratively improve the platform.
Qualifications
As we deal largely with data and
ML, Python and/or Java is essential
. We will consider applications from people who may not be a perfect match for our tech stack, but are willing to learn. It is important to have a strong background in backend software engineering (7+ years of experience) and a keen interest in data or ML engineering.
Ideally you will have experience with the following:
Python
Java
Data pipelines
SQL
Spark/Databricks
AWS
CI/CD and DevOps
ML pipelines
In addition to using technical knowledge to drive features and improvements, you are comfortable and show experience with:
Working with rapidly evolving designs and requirements
Working well within a team
Excellent interpersonal skills
Curious mind and strong problem-solving skills
Autonomy, responsibility and striving to make a difference
Positive, can-do attitude with a clear sense of initiative
Takes responsibility and accountability for the overall solution
Strong focus on creating testable software, using standards and conventions to ensure quality
Good understanding of secure coding practices
Additional Information
The Team
Pricing and Performance is a large team and is responsible for solving some of the most exciting and challenging problems for SEEK. You will join a team of 40 data scientist, engineers, and product managers working across three problem spaces.
Why SEEK
Extensive employee benefits
Hybrid working mode
Mature and collaborative working culture
At SEEK, we are passionate about fostering a culture of inclusion and wellbeing that embraces and values the diversity of our people. We are a purpose driven business that works with heart.
We know teams with diverse ideas, experiences and perspectives are more creative and are critical to ensuring effective delivery and innovating to enable our future success. Title: Senior Data Engineer
Full Job Description:
Why AirAsia Move
Are you ready to take off and be part of AirAsia Move? AirAsia Move is the latest offering from AirAsia Group, focused on leveraging cutting-edge technologies to build and scale data-driven products and services across the travel, e-commerce, and logistics ecosystems. We are transforming the way people experience travel by offering seamless access to travel-related services. As part of our expansion, we are looking for a talented Senior Data Engineer to join our growing team and help us unlock the full potential of our data capabilities.
Key Responsibilities:
Data Architecture & Pipeline Development:
Design and implement scalable, reliable, and optimized data pipelines for seamless data ingestion, transformation, and delivery.
Build and maintain end-to-end data workflows, ensuring efficient data processing for both real-time and batch systems.
Work with stakeholders across product, analytics, and engineering teams to ensure data solutions align with business needs.
Optimize and maintain data pipelines for performance, scalability, and cost-efficiency.
Cloud Infrastructure & Data Integration:
Leverage cloud platforms (e.g., Google Cloud) to build and scale data solutions.
Work with various data integration technologies (e.g., APIs, ETL tools, Kafka, Pub/Sub) to ensure seamless data flow between systems.
Implement data versioning, lineage, and governance to maintain data integrity, security, and compliance.
Data Quality & Monitoring:
Ensure that data quality, accuracy, and consistency are maintained across all data pipelines and systems.
Implement and monitor data quality checks, logging, and alerting to ensure early detection of issues in the data pipelines.
Continuously evaluate and improve data architectures, ensuring data availability and minimising downtime.
Collaboration & Leadership:
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including data scientists, engineers, product managers, and DevOps teams to support business needs.
Contribute to best practices in data engineering, code quality, testing, and deployment.
Mentor junior data engineers, sharing knowledge and driving a culture of innovation and efficiency.
Innovation & Continuous Improvement:
Stay up to date with the latest trends, tools, and technologies in the data engineering space.
Propose innovative solutions to improve the speed, quality, and scalability of data systems.
Drive automation and optimization initiatives to enhance overall data infrastructure efficiency.
Required Qualifications:
Education & Experience:
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Data Science, or a related field, or equivalent practical experience.
4+ years of hands-on experience in data engineering, with a strong track record of building scalable data pipelines and infrastructure.
Proven experience in building large-scale, cloud-based data infrastructure for high-volume, high-velocity data.
Strong experience with ETL tools, data orchestration frameworks (e.g., Google Cloud Composer), and batch/streaming data processing (e.g., Apache Kafka, Spark).
Experience working with Google Cloud Platform (GCP) or similar cloud services.
Technical Skills:
Proficiency in Python, SQL, or Scala; experience with relational and NoSQL databases (e.g., BigQuery, MongoDB, PostgreSQL).
Deep understanding of data warehousing concepts and experience in designing and managing data models.
Proficiency in GCP Services such as BigQuery, Cloud Storage, Cloud Pub/Sub, Dataflow, Composer, Cloud Functions & Cloud Run.
Experience with data governance, data quality, and data privacy best practices.
Familiarity with containerization technologies (Docker, Kubernetes) and infrastructure-as-code (Terraform, CloudFormation) is a plus.
Soft Skills:
Strong problem-solving and analytical skills, with a focus on scalability and efficiency.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with experience working in cross-functional teams.
Ability to translate complex technical concepts into business value for non-technical stakeholders.
Passion for mentoring and developing junior team members.
Why Join Us?
Be part of an innovative, fast-growing data team at AirAsia Move.
Work on cutting-edge cloud-based and real-time data solutions.
Opportunity to make a real impact in the travel, e-commerce, and logistics industries.
A culture that encourages innovation, learning, and collaboration.
If you are passionate about data engineering and eager to work on exciting challenges in a dynamic environment, we would love to hear from you!

Title: Senior AI Solution Architect - MRO Cloud
Full Job Description:
As the AI Solution Architect, you will play a pivotal role in shaping the technical direction and architectural vision for our AI initiatives. You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to translate business requirements into scalable and innovative AI solutions.
This role requires a blend of technical expertise, strategic vision, and effective stakeholder engagement to drive the successful delivery of AI-powered applications.
Key Responsibilities:
1. Strategic Direction and Vision:
Define and drive the technical direction for AI/ML/Generative AI initiatives, aligning solutions with client business goals and digital transformation strategies. Translate complex business objectives into actionable technical strategies, while proactively identifying potential risks or misaligned initiatives in client engagements.
2. Architectural Design and Technology Selection:
Design robust AI engineering frameworks to support the deployment, evaluation, and management of AI/ML models and Generative AI solutions for client projects. Evaluate and recommend the best technologies for clients, ensuring scalability, interoperability, and alignment with industry best practices. Contribute to the development of MLOps and LLMOps practices, focusing on operational efficiency for client organizations.
3. Client Collaboration and Stakeholder Engagement:
Engage with client stakeholders, including business leaders, data scientists, engineers, and architects, to refine AI solutions and ensure alignment with their business objectives. Collaborate on use case development and solution optimization, fostering strong partnerships and ensuring that technical strategies address current and future business needs.
4. Prototyping and Solution Validation:
Lead the development of AI prototypes that demonstrate the potential and feasibility of AI/ML solutions for client use cases. Design and implement rapid prototypes to test and validate AI models, ensuring alignment with client needs and business objectives. Iterate and refine prototypes based on client feedback and technical evaluations to accelerate solution adoption.
5. Market Research and Competitive Analysis:
Conduct in-depth market research to assess client industry trends and AI needs, while performing comparative analyses of the company’s AI products versus competitor offerings. Identify unique selling points and craft compelling competitive advantages for client proposals, helping to position the company’s AI solutions as the best fit for client objectives and market opportunities.
6. Product Strategy and Business Understanding:

Provide strategic insights into the strengths and weaknesses of the company’s AI products, helping shape AI product roadmaps and client proposals to deliver differentiated value.

Provide data-driven insights to help clients make informed decisions on technology trade-offs and prioritize AI innovations that drive long-term business value.
Required Qualifications:

At least 5 years or above of experience in AI field.

Extensive hands-on experience in driving the development of AI solutions from concept to execution. This includes designing, building, and iterating on AI/ML models and deploying them in real-world, high-stakes environments, utilizing cloud native services.
Ability to travel as needed based on project requirements.
Contract(s) position available.
Preferred Qualifications:
At least Bachelor Degrees or above in the related field.
At least 5 years or above of experience in AI field.
Experience in providing strategic consultancy to organizations on the adoption and integration of advanced AI and Cloud solutions. Skilled in guiding clients through the entire lifecycle of AI projects—from ideation and proof-of-concept to full-scale deployment.
Experience in data engineering and building scalable data pipelines to support AI/ML workflows. Proficiency in data ingestion, ETL processes, data cleaning, and transformation using tools like Apache Kafka, Apache Spark, Airflow, and SQL/NoSQL databases.
Proficiency in deploying and optimizing AI workloads on GPU-based infrastructures. Understanding of GPU hardware configurations and how to leverage GPU clusters for scalability and performance optimization.
Deep knowledge of Generative AI/LLMs, with experience dabbling with pre-training, SFT, RLHF and productionizing agentic solutions.

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer (Game)
Full Job Description:
PLAY, GROW and WIN
To be a part of Virtuos means to be a creator.
At Virtuos, we harness the latest technologies to make games better and more immersive than ever before. That is why we pride ourselves in constantly pushing the boundaries of possibility since our founding in 2004.
Virtuosi is a team of experts – people who have come together to share their mutual passion for making and playing games. People with the same enthusiasm for exploring new ideas and the constant drive to excel in their field. People who believe in earning success through dedication.
At Virtuos, we are at the forefront of gaming, creating exciting new experiences daily. Join us to Play, Grow and Win – together.
ABOUT THE POSITION
We are seeking an innovative Machine Learning Engineer with a passion for building AI assistants and automation tools for our Game ML team. In this role, you will focus on developing and enhancing AI-driven products that assist game developers by leveraging state-of-the-art machine learning techniques and technologies, including Agentic AI, Large Language Models (LLMs), and Small Language Models (SLMs).
Design, develop, and implement machine learning models with a focus on large language models (LLMs), small language models (SLMs), agentic AI agents, and multi-modal models for various tasks and applications.
Collaborate with stakeholders, software engineers, and product teams to define problems, develop solutions, build proofs of concept, conduct experiments, and deploy solutions using modern tools and best practices.
Integrate AI-based solutions into various tech stacks and game engines, such as Maya, Blender, Houdini, Unreal Engine, and Unity.
Develop and maintain our in-house Machine-Learning-as-a-Service (MLaaS) platform.
Stay up to date with the latest advancements in AI/ML, particularly in LLMs, Agentic AI, and Natural Language Processing (NLP).
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Machine Learning, or a related field.
5+ years of hands-on experience in Statistical Machine Learning and Deep Learning, with a focus on Natural Language Processing (NLP), Language Models, and Reinforcement Learning.
2+ years of game development experience, working independently or with indie, AA, or AAA studios.
Proficiency in deep learning frameworks (e.g., PyTorch, TensorFlow) and data processing tools (e.g., PySpark, BigQuery).
Experience with game development tools for Digital Content Creation (DCC) and game engines, including Blender, Houdini, Maya, Unreal Engine, and Unity.
Experience deploying ML models via REST APIs.
Experience with NLP techniques, such as sentiment analysis, topic clustering, and question-answering for dataset validation.
Experience with Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA) and Data Visualization
Experience with Docker and Virtual Machines on Windows and Linux platforms.
Experience with LLM frameworks, including LangChain, LangGraph, and DeepEval.
Familiarity with Docker and Virtual Machines on Windows and Linux platforms
Familiarity with common databases such as Postgres and MongoDB
Familiarity with Cloud Services such as AWS, GCP or Azure and their Machine Learning and Machine Learning Operations (MLOps) for both managed and unmanaged services.
Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience in building game development tools, plugins or modding games
Strong expertise in prompt engineering and chain-of-thought with the ability to measure and validate the effectiveness of different prompting techniques using scientific and data-driven methods.
Experience optimizing test-time/inference-time compute to enhance LLM/SLM outputs.
Knowledge of prompt security techniques, including rail guards, prompt injection defense, and red teaming.
Familiarity with recent advancements in Generative AI, including image generation, 3D asset generation, animation, sound & music generation, and voice cloning.

Title: L3 Data Support Engineer
Full Job Description:
OUR COMPANY
TCR Group is the leading European provider of integrated solutions for GSE (Ground Support Equipment) in aviation. TCR offers rental, lease and maintenance of GSE. We are headquartered in Belgium, have approximately 1500 employees and are operational in over 180 airports in 18 countries, in Europe, Asia Pacific and the USA.
Join our team and be a part of an organization where your contributions truly matter. Apply now and embark on an exciting career as an IT Business Partner, making a meaningful impact every day.
WHY TCR?
A top international team where we live by our company values.
A company with short decision lines where our employees are central to the success of the company.
An environment where you can develop and grow.
ABOUT THE JOB
We are seeking an experienced and highly skilled Data Support Engineer (Level 3) to join our operations team based in our Group Shared Services Department in Cyberjaya. This role requires an individual with deep expertise in managing complex data infrastructure, solving intricate data-related issues, and providing strategic data support across multiple business units.
As a Data Support Engineer, you will work directly with data engineers, analysts, and IT teams to ensure the smooth flow of high-quality data across our organization’s systems, offering solutions to incidents, performance bottlenecks, data anomalies, and integration challenges. Your ability to analyse and optimize data pipelines, coupled with a strong understanding of cloud and on-premises data technologies, will be crucial in driving operational efficiency and supporting data-driven decision-making
WHERE YOU’LL CREATE THE MOST IMPACT
Resolve complex data integration and performance issues across large-scale systems.
Optimize ETL/ELT pipelines in both on-prem and cloud (AWS, Azure, GCP) environments.
Automate monitoring and workflows using tools like Python, Bash, and Airflow.
Conduct root cause analyses and lead post-incident reviews.
Document systems and share best practices across teams.
Mentor junior engineers and promote engineering excellence.
Diagnose and resolve complex data integration and processing issues across large-scale distributed systems.
Troubleshoot performance bottlenecks, data quality issues, and system failures, ensuring minimal downtime and high availability of critical data services
WHAT YOU'LL BRING AS THE IDEAL CANDIDATE
Bachelor’s in Computer Science, Data Engineering, Information System, or a related field. A Master Degree is a plus.
10+ years of hands-on experience in data engineering, operations, or support—especially in large-scale, cloud-based environments preferably in an international company.
Expert in SQL and NoSQL databases (e.g., MySQL, PostgreSQL, Redshift, MongoDB, Cassandra).
Proficient in programming languages (e.g. Python, Scala, or Java) for data integration, automation, and problem-solving.
Deep experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) and Microsoft data services (e.g., Azure Storage, Azure Databricks, Azure Synapse Analytics, Azure SQL Database, Microsoft Fabric, Microsoft Purview).
Solid understanding of ETL/ELT processes and modern data warehousing.
Proven ability to troubleshoot, optimize, and scale complex data workflows.
Strong problem-solver with a customer-first mindset and a track record of translating business needs into technical solutions.
Excellent communicator and experienced mentor with the ability to lead and collaborate across teams.

Title: Data Scientist (Internal Audit)
Full Job Description:
Are you ready to get ahead in your career?
We want to empower you to turn your ambitions into achievements.
We thrive in inclusiveness, diversity and embrace close collaborations for you to create impact for yourself and others.
Together, we aim to bring the best of technology to help people, businesses and the nation to be ahead in a changing world.
To realise our vision to become Malaysia’s leading converged solutions company, we are looking for a new talent to innovate and grow with us in a culture that values commitment, performance and possibilities.
Why does this job exist and why is it critical?​
This role is to carry out the responsibilities in ensuring that the Internal Assurance’s data science capabilities are effectively implemented and operated, especially in the design, development and operation of the continuous auditing technologies and processes. The role will essentially help IA to innovate in gaining insights on the risks, governance and controls through advancement in audit automation technologies and processes such as data analytics, Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Robotics Process Automation (RPA).
What are you accountable for?
Analyse audit analytics requirements and translate into audit automation solutions using applicable technologies e.g. ETL, data analytics, AI and/or RPA
Develop, test, implement, operate and maintain ETL, data analytics, AI and/or other automation solutions using suitable tools or systems with satisfactory quality, accompanied with adequate level of documentation
Liaise with stakeholders to obtain continuous data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain a suitable database platform for IA’s automation purposes
Design and develop data reporting tools and processes for continuous assurance results, which include data visualization using related data visualization tools
Identify new ideas for process improvements/enhancements and develop, test and implement using related current technologies/methodologies for roll-out
Implement and carry out adequate data governance activities to ensure confidentiality, integrity and availability of stored and processed data by the continuous assurance platform
Provide technical support to the team and/or business counterparts in the areas of technical audit data analysis, automation and related tools/technologies as well as coaching the team on usage of those tools/technologies
Working closely and build relationship with Stakeholders for ensuring effective continuous assurance service deliverables from Internal Assurance Division
Providing consultative advice to Stakeholders by identifying and recommending value-added data analytics insights and approach
What do you need to have for this role?
Bachelor Degree in Mathematics and Statistics, Computer Science, or Engineering
Masters in Data Science / Data Analytics Certifications will be an added advantage
4-6 years of total working experience (At least 3+ years of working experience relevant to the field of data science
Technical expertise in data analytics, data visualization, machine learning and ETL techniques
Strong knowledge of and experience with databases (e.g. Microsoft SQL), programming languages (e.g. Python), SQL scripting, ETL platforms (e.g. MS SSIS), data reporting and visualization tools (e.g. Looker Studio, Power BI etc.)
Proven knowledge utilising common data science toolkits such as Python, R, SQL, etc.
Proficient in data visualization and data storytelling
Strong statistical, analytical, and problem solving skills
Familiarity with cloud platforms and technologies e.g. Google Cloud Platform, Azure, AWS etc.
Passionate in learning new technologies and skills
Desirable
Proven experience in building predictive models
Knowledge and/or proven experience in using RPA tools (e.g. UiPath)
Internal or external auditing experience
What’s next?
Once you’ve applied online, our team will carefully review your application. Due to a high volume of applications, we appreciate your patience to allow for a fair and timely review process.
Should you be shortlisted for the role, we will send you an invitation via email for a digital interview. You can also check on your application status by logging into your candidate account.
Maxis values diverse voices & people. We hire and reward our employees based on capability & performance — regardless of ethnicity, gender, age, education, religion, nationality or physical ability.

Title: Lead Data Scientist, Deliveries & ACE
Full Job Description:
Get to know the Team
In the ACE (Deliveries, Mart, Omnicommerce) Data Science team you are at the core and center of Grab’s delivery and omnicommerce business. We build and deploy AI/ML models to empower seamless user experiences across Grab’s food ecosystem, from meal deliveries to restaurant reservations. Our mission is to enhance user satisfaction, drive growth, and optimize platform efficiency by leveraging data science to solve unique challenges in delivery, demand forecasting, and personalized dining experiences.
Get to know the role
We are looking for Lead data scientists who will own their projects end-to-end, from defining the problem space, proposing scalable DS solutions, implementing DS services and to conducting experiments and model enhancement. You will work closely with cross functional stakeholders including Engineering, analytics, Product etc, independently to deliver advanced data-driven solutions.
The Critical Tasks You Will Perform
Extract Insights: Analyze massive datasets (geospatial, behavioral, transactional) to understand user shopping patterns, improve user experiences for delivery and dine-out/Reserve services.
Identify business opportunity and propose AI solutions to solve user problem and create business impact:
User Experience: Predicting users shopping needs & shopping patterns, shopping preference, cancellation probability and etc. Identify ways to improve our user experience by providing them most personalised recommendations, improving service reliability, etc
Demand Forecasting: Predict meal delivery demand spikes and restaurant reservation trends.
Demand Shaping: optimise visibility to ensure we are shaping demand to meet supply to optimise the network throughput and reduce unfulfilled demand
Demand generation: enable smart targeting of different user segments for demand generation
Build, Iterate and Deploy: Build AI models to enable business. Continuously refine models through A/B testing and production monitoring.
Collaborate Cross-Functionally: Partner with product managers, engineers, analytics, design and operations teams to scale solutions.
Contribute to team’s innovation and IP creation

Title: Continuous Improvement Analyst
Full Job Description:
About the Role:
As the pioneer Continuous Improvement Analyst at Brooks Automation Malaysia, you will play a pivotal role in enhancing operational and organizational efficiency and effectiveness within our brand-new factory in Johor Bahru, Malaysia. Your key responsibilities will encompass driving efficiency, enhancing processes, and fostering a culture of continuous improvement.
Reporting to the Continuous Improvement Manager, you will work closely across multiple departments in leading projects which optimize cost, quality, and schedule requirements within the Brooks Manufacturing sites.
Key Responsibilities:
Operations
: Utilizing improvement methodologies, tools and techniques such as Lean, Six Sigma, or other improvement frameworks to identify, scope and implement continuous improvement projects include project selection, scope and overall assignment, launch, prioritization tracking and deliverable align with KPI targets and site business.
Manufacturing Process Automation:
Primarily focus on using Phyton programming and any other similar programing language to develop and implement process automation, data science management and machine learning enhancing operational efficiency.
Data Analysis:
Conduct surveys and analyze best practices of improvement methodologies, tools and techniques such as Lean, Six Sigma, or other improvement frameworks to assess current processes, develop improvement strategies and measure the impact of improvement initiatives.
Foster Continuous Improvement Culture:
Work with leaders and cross functional team to coach continuous improvement methodologies, tools and techniques ensure they are trained, equipped and utilized best practice in driving operational efficiencies.
Documentation and communication:
Develop and maintain accurate document update with latest improvement as well as communicate effectively to the involved stakeholder.
Key Performance Indicator:
Successful outcomes should include quantifiable results in reduction of production cycle times, decreased waste (7 methods of waste in Lean), increased visibility into KPIs and an improvement in 4 key categories Safety, Quality, Output and Cost while qualitative result in achieving issue identified for longer term improvement, coaching & training and effectiveness apply best practice of continuous improvement methodologies, tools and techniques.
Any other duties as assigned.
Qualifications & Competencies:
Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Business Administration or a related field with 5 ~ 7 years of related work experience in a similar role, ideally within the Semiconductor capital equipment or related high-tech, manufacturing industry.
Proficient in Python programming, with essential coding skills to develop and implement process automation, data science management, and machine learning solutions, enhancing operational efficiency.
In-depth knowledge of Lean, Six Sigma or other improvement frameworks.
Capable in collecting data and simulating processes, materials, and manufacturing workflows, providing valuable input to cross functional team and management.
Proven track record of successful continuous improvement execution.

Title: Data Scientist - QuantumBlack
Full Job Description:
Driving lasting impact and building long-term capabilities with our clients is not easy work. You are the kind of person who thrives in a high performance/high reward culture - doing hard things, picking yourself up when you stumble, and having the resilience to try another way forward.
In return for your drive, determination, and curiosity, we'll provide the resources, mentorship, and opportunities you need to become a stronger leader faster than you ever thought possible. Your colleagues—at all levels—will invest deeply in your development, just as much as they invest in delivering exceptional results for clients. Every day, you'll receive apprenticeship, coaching, and exposure that will accelerate your growth in ways you won’t find anywhere else.
When you join us, you will have:
Continuous learning:
Our learning and apprenticeship culture, backed by structured programs, is all about helping you grow while creating an environment where feedback is clear, actionable, and focused on your development. The real magic happens when you take the input from others to heart and embrace the fast-paced learning experience, owning your journey.
A voice that matters:
From day one, we value your ideas and contributions. You’ll make a tangible impact by offering innovative ideas and practical solutions. We not only encourage diverse perspectives, but they are critical in driving us toward the best possible outcomes.
Global community:
With colleagues across 65+ countries and over 100 different nationalities, our firm’s diversity fuels creativity and helps us come up with the best solutions for our clients. Plus, you’ll have the opportunity to learn from exceptional colleagues with diverse backgrounds and experiences.
World-class benefits:
On top of a competitive salary (based on your location, experience, and skills), we provide a comprehensive benefits package, which includes medical, dental, mental health, and vision coverage for you, your spouse/partner, and children.
Only at McKinsey you will work on real-world, high-impact projects across a variety of industries. You will have the opportunity to collaborate with QB/Labs teams and build complex and innovative ML systems to accelerate our work in AI and help solve business problems at speed and scale.
You will experience the best environment to grow as a technologist and a leader. You will develop a sought-after perspective connecting technology and business value by working on real-life problems across a variety of industries and technical challenges to serve our clients on their changing needs.
You will be surrounded by inspiring individuals as part of diverse and multidisciplinary teams. You will develop a holistic perspective of AI by partnering with the best design, technical, and business talent in the world as your team members.
While we advocate for using the right tech for the right task, we often leverage the following technologies: Python, PySpark, the PyData stack, SQL, Airflow, Databricks, our own open-source data pipelining framework called Kedro, Dask/RAPIDS, container technologies such as Docker and Kubernetes, cloud solutions such as AWS, GCP, and Azure, and more.
As a Data Scientist, you will:
Partner with our clients, from data owners and users to C-level executives, to understand their needs and build impactful analytics solutions
Contribute to cross-functional problem-solving sessions with your team and deliver presentations to colleagues and client
Translate business problems into analytical problems and develop models aimed at solving our clients and users problems and ensure they are evaluated with the relevant metrics
Write highly optimized code to advance our internal Data Science Toolbox
Add real-world impact to your academic expertise, as you are encouraged to write papers and present at meetings and conferences should you wish
Take part in R&D projects; attend conferences such as NIPS and ICML as well as data science retrospectives where you will have the opportunity to share and learn from your co-workers
Work in one of the most advanced data science teams globally
Work on the frameworks and libraries that our teams of data scientists and data engineers use to progress from data to impact
Guide global companies through data science solutions to transform their businesses and enhance performance across industries including healthcare, automotive, energy and elite sport
You will work with other data scientists, data engineers, machine learning engineers, designers and project managers on interdisciplinary projects, using math, stats and machine learning to derive structure and knowledge from raw data across various industry sectors.
You are highly collaborative individual who is capable of laying aside your own agenda, listening to and learning from colleagues, challenging thoughtfully and prioritizing impact. You search for ways to improve things and work collaboratively with colleagues. You believe in iterative change, experimenting with new approaches, learning and improving to move forward quickly.
Bachelor's, master's or PhD level in a discipline such as: computer science, machine learning, applied statistics, mathematics, engineering or artificial intelligence
2+ years of professional experience in applying machine learning and data mining techniques to real problems with copious amounts of data
Programming experience (focus on machine learning): SQL and Python’s Data Science stack are a must; good knowledge of at least one big data framework (Pyspark, Hive, Hadoop) is a plus; R, SPSS, SAS (nice to have); Software Engineering is a plus
Ability to prototype statistical analysis and modeling algorithms and apply these algorithms for data driven solutions to problems in new domains
Experience deploying technology applied to business problems is a plus
Knowledge in applying machine learning solution to real problems with complex and/or big amounts of data
Knowledge in prompt engineering & GenAI application building (RAG, Agentic systems). Having basic understanding of Engineering standards, QA/Risk Management
Willingness to travel

Title: AI Engineer
Full Job Description:

We are looking for a passionate AI Engineer with 4–5 years of hands-on experience in developing and deploying AI/ML models. You will contribute to designing scalable AI systems, training models, and supporting real-world deployment for autonomous vehicles and other AI-centric applications. Title: AI Ops
Full Job Description:
Role: AI Opsn
Duration: 1 year, renewable
Location: Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
JOB DESCRIPTION
Role and Responsibilities
AIOps Strategy and Implementation
: Develop and execute a comprehensive AIOps strategy to modernize IT operations, focusing on AI-driven incident management and predictive analytics. Collaborate with stakeholders to identify high impact use cases, prioritize initiatives, and define KPIs for success (e.g., reduced MTTR, increased uptime).
AIOps Platform Management
: Evaluate, configure, and manage AIOps platforms (e.g., BigPanda) to aggregate, normalize, and correlate alerts from monitoring tools. Implement AI/ML models for anomaly detection, root cause analysis, and incident prioritization.
Automation Integration
: Design and implement automation workflows using tools like Ansible and Rundeck, integrated with AIOps platforms via APIs and webhooks. Develop scripts and playbooks to automate incident remediation, provisioning, and configuration tasks for self-healing systems.
I
nfrastructure as Code (IaC) and Configuration Management
: Apply IaC principles using tools like Terraform and Ansible to manage infrastructure resources programmatically. Utilize configuration management tools to ensure compliance and remediate configuration drift across servers and cloud instances.
Predictive Analytics and Monitoring
: Leverage AIOps platforms to monitor IT environments, predict potential incidents, and optimize performance. Analyse metrics and trends to proactively address bottlenecks and scalability challenges.
CI/CD and DevOps Integration
: Integrate AIOps and automation solutions with CI/CD pipelines to support automated testing, deployment, and infrastructure changes. Implement version control and audit trails for automation and AIOps artifacts.
Documentation and Knowledge Sharing
: Document AIOps workflows, automation scripts, and best practices to enable knowledge transfer. Provide training to IT teams on AIOps tools, automation techniques, and incident management processes.
Mandatory skills
Strong expertise in AIOps platforms (e.g., BigPanda, Splunk) for incident correlation and predictive analytics. Proficiency in automation tools (Ansible, Rundeck) and scripting languages (Python, Bash, PowerShell). Experience across infrastructure stacks (Linux, Windows, cloud environments) and knowledge of cloud platforms (Azure, GCP).

Title: Senior Data Scientist (Analytics) - Mobility
Full Job Description:
Get to Know the Team:
The Analytics team's mission is to use data and experimentation to advance product innovation. We love building hacky products to test and iterate what's best for our customers. As we ship multiple products every week, it means we have to fine-tune models, run and evaluate hundreds of experiments weekly! We are looking for experienced data scientists to build a center of data excellence for Product & Experimentation in a diverse range of tech families. Your role is to guide a data-first approach to product thinking, design controlled experiments, and be objective while evaluating results, all of this while working with stakeholders to evaluate innovative product and business ideas! You will help developers, designers & product managers across the company with recommendations on how to learn from unexpected results, study underlying causes for them, and iterate on the next set of products to build for our users.
Get to Know the Role:
Reporting to the Product Analytics Manager, you will work closely with different teams within a business line (Product, Business, Engineering, Design, and Data Science) to understand data requirements, identify and track key metrics, and provide data-driven insights. You will also work with stakeholders to evaluate the feasibility of new business/product ideas and provide appropriate recommendations.
This role is based in Petaling Jaya and onsite.
The Critical Tasks You Will Perform
You will analyze existing data and recommend new product ideas to address impactful customer problems based on business objectives.
You will identify trends, spot anomalies, and investigate their root causes using data.
You will utilize your data analysis and visualization skills to present insights and tell a compelling story to a non-technical audience.
You will collaborate with stakeholders to align on key product metrics and propose experimentation strategies, including A/B testing.
You will design and manage data specifications for new products, ensuring accurate data collection in collaboration with engineering teams.
You will mentor junior team members, promote high standards in data handling, and develop scalable frameworks to address recurring problems efficiently.

Title: Graduate Associate (Digital)
Full Job Description:
About the Programme
ML Performance is one of the largest e-commerce based auto parts distributors in Europe. By being fully online based, adopting a direct factory-to-consumer model and utilizing 4IR technologies such as Machine Learning & Python Automation - it aims to revolutionize how the auto parts industry currently functions.
The Global Graduate Talent Programme
at ML Performance aims to identify outstanding graduates and subsequently give their careers a head-start. Through this programme, we want to groom future leaders in the organization, to lead both our regional headquarters in Kuala Lumpur and eventually at our global headquarters in London.
If you are fresh out of school or about to graduate, and have the energy, the enthusiasm and the passion to excel – then this Global Graduate Talent Programme is for you. You may be new to what we do, but you will be provided with special access to each and every level of our organization to allow you to thoroughly understand our business.
This programme is open to graduates from all academic disciplines. You are not required to have a Business or Economics degree. We find that applicants from different disciplines often times bring different skill sets and perspectives to our organization – and as an organization that values diversity a lot, we welcome you regardless of your background!
Note that even if you have graduated for quite a few years and have a few years of experience you are still more than welcome to apply to this programme, we judge each application on a case by case basis.

Health Allowance

Data Analyst

: Penang - George Town

Rotational shift

Contract
We are seeking meticulous and skilled Data Analyst (Email Grader) to join the team. In this role, you will be responsible for annotating emails to train AI filters, examining email elements and associated data for categorization, and identifying malicious content. If you’re detail-oriented and ready to drive improvements, we’d love to hear from you!

Email Annotation
: Annotate emails for AI filters machine learning.
Email Examination
: Review various email elements, including appearance, headers, links, and attachments. Analyze online resources related to internet domain and IP address reputations to determine email categories.
